file_content.text: I intend to stay here, and watch over the vault. May the Force be with you.
Master Bestros. I found the Infernal One.
It called to us with its dying words. We heard everything.
You met an... incomprehensible power; you may have saved the whole galaxy.
It couldn't have happened without all of us working together.
This was a team effort.
The creature had an army of True Sith. What do you make of it?
It said it ruled Korriban.
They say the Rakata ruled many worlds, once. This one found the darkness on Korriban--or brought the darkness there.
Another day, another job.
Regardless, I'm glad you were here.
Your victory today won't bring you glory, nor will it change the march of the Empire, but nobler deeds are rarely seen.
Yet the Eternity Vault remains. Let us hope we've seen the worst of its prisoners.
The Eternity Vault is open to you. We shall be waiting.
A sickness in the Force.
We uncovered Rakata carvings that may shed light on our foe--they speak of a Rakata warlord imprisoned here.
"The Infernal One," who enslaved a thousand worlds; who "drowned the sea of stars in blood," so far as I can translate.
Warlords and emperors have always plagued free people. But they never win.
Conquerors always fall.
I knew it was right to call on you.
The Esh-kha weren't the monsters the Rakata believed. Maybe this "Infernal One" will listen to reason, as well.
Maybe we can talk to it.
We can hope, but be ready.
If something that powerful gets off Belsavis, we'll have a bigger problem than the Empire.
This could change the war.
I worried you wouldn't understand, but of course a soldier sees the war clearer than I.
You know who I am. You called me to deal with a world-smashing freak show?
You've got to be kidding.
The Force is with you, whether you know it or not--and I trust in the Force.
These carvings--what else do they say?
What more do we know?
The legend mentions an army of ancient species, united to defeat him. He was buried with his servants and his treasures.
Gather your team, as many allies as you can find, and stop the Infernal One. I fear for our galaxy if he escapes.
We'll deal with the Eternity Vault. Make sure the Empire doesn't follow.
Stay here and guard the rear.
It will be done. May the Force be with you.
Let's do this.
All our hopes go with you.
I fear for the galaxy too, but that doesn't mean I'll save it for free.
Hold on--what do I get?
I'm sure there will be... adequate plunder in the vault. And if there isn't, the order will repay you.
You've been on Belsavis too long. There's nothing to worry about in there.
You're afraid of nothing.
Be cautious, please. And may the Force be with you.
We must be ready. The Empire will come... and so will the imprisoned.
Hero of Tython. I do apologize for the interruption--I've heard much about your struggles from Master Satele.
Master Jedi, forgive my interruption, and let me convey my sympathies regarding Master Syo--he was a good friend.
Major, I hope I'm not interrupting your duties. I was consulting with Senator Arnus, and he offered me your name.
Captain, we've never met, but I received your name from Master Sumalee.
I am Shol Bestros, chief historian of the Jedi Council. I have a troubling situation on Belsavis, and your wisdom could prove helpful.
What can I do for the Jedi Council, Master Bestros?
I'm at your service.
It's an honor, Master Bestros. I'm surprised we haven't met before.
Pleasure to meet you.
Truth be told, I'd been hoping to speak to you about your time on Tython--but that will have to wait.
You're not calling up Havoc Squad for wisdom. What do you need?
Be straight with me, sir.
Never had the Jedi Council come to me for advice. What's going on?
You've got my attention.
I thought the fighting on Belsavis had died down. What does the Council's historian want there?
More problems on Belsavis?
As soon as I leave, Belsavis falls apart. Guess that's no shock.
No surprise things went bad.
I only arrived recently myself, so I couldn't say.
I came to Belsavis to study the alien prison, and I've found references to a section called the "Eternity Vault."
The vault contained the greatest enemies of the ancient Rakata, and was said to be permanently sealed under thousands of tonnes of rock.
This "Eternity Vault"--you know where it is?
I take it you found something.
I suspect. The Imperials broke open a section of one of the glaciers.
I know what kind of beings the Rakata imprisoned. What makes this vault different?
What kind of enemies?
The Rakata kept most of their prisoners alive on purpose. The Eternity Vault was for the ones they couldn't kill.
During a recent Imperial bombing run, a new set of caves was uncovered. I fear the Eternity Vault has been opened.
We've got the Empire attacking the Core Worlds; I can't deal with this now.
The war is my top priority.
If we don't stop what's happening here, the Empire may become the least of our worries.
Colonel Fhorjack, shipboard security--we have an incoming message for you from the Belsavis orbital station.
I saw reports that a Sith strike team on Belsavis had disappeared. They found something in this "Eternity Vault"...?
Coordinates are attached to his message. I'll prepare a vessel to take you to the Eternity Vault once you've assembled a strike force.
I am relieved to see you return intact. After the destruction of your transport, we feared for you.
Patching you through to Master Bestros now.
You have full access to the ship.
Your vessel is prepared to take you to the Eternity Vault.
You have done us all a great service.
Don't waste time.
